item.title: Kelly add a quote by William Goldman
item.description: "People don't remember me. Really. It's not a paranoid thing; I just have this habit of slipping through memories. It doesn't bother me all that much, except I guess that's a lie; it does. For some reason, I test very high on forgettability." -- William Goldman

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "You can't just eat good food. You've got to talk about it too. And you've got to talk about it to somebody who understands that kind of food." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Stephen Chbosky
item.description: "It's just that I don't want to be somebody's crush. If somebody likes me, I want them to like the real me, not what they think I am. And I don't want them to carry it around inside. I want them to show me, so I can feel it too." -- Stephen Chbosky

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Emily Jane Brontë
item.description: "If all else perished, and he remained, I should still continue to be; and if all else remained, and he were annihilated, the universe would turn to a mighty stranger." -- Emily Jane Brontë

item.title: Kelly add a quote by charles dickens
item.description: "To conceal anything from those to whom I am attached, is not in my nature. I can never close my lips where I have opened my heart." -- charles dickens

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I do not want people to be very agreeable, as it saves me the trouble of liking them a great deal." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "It's no good pretending that any relationship has a future if your record collections disagree violently or if your favorite films wouldn't even speak to each other if they met at a party." -- Nick Hornby

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "Kiss me, and you will see how important I am." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "There are few people whom I really love, and still fewer of whom I think well. The more I see of the world, the more am I dissatisfied with it; and every day confirms my belief of the inconsistency of all human characters, and of the little dependence that can be placed on the appearance of merit or sense." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Stephen Chbosky
item.description: "There's nothing like deep breaths after laughing that hard. Nothing in the world like a sore stomach for the right reasons." -- Stephen Chbosky

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Paul Terry
item.description: "Whenever I feel the need to exercise, I lie down until it goes away." -- Paul Terry

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "For what do we live, but to make sport for our neighbors, and laugh at them in our turn?" -- Jane Austen

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Stephen Chbosky
item.description: "We accept the love we think we deserve." -- Stephen Chbosky

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Dodie Smith
item.description: "And no bathroom on earth will make up for marrying a bearded man you hate." -- Dodie Smith

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "I'd thought I'd live with my wife, but I couldn't find one." -- Nick Hornby

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Without music, life would be a mistake." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Stephen Chbosky
item.description: "I walk around the school hallways and look at the people. I look at the teachers and wonder why they're here. If they like their jobs. Or us. And I wonder how smart they were when they were fifteen. Not in a mean way. In a curious way. It's like looking at all the students and wondering who's had their heart broken that day, and how they are able to cope with having three quizzes and a book report due on top of that. Or wondering who did the heart breaking. And wondering why." -- Stephen Chbosky

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Rumer Godden
item.description: "There is an Indian proverb that says that everyone is a house with four rooms, a physical, a mental, an emtional, and a spiritual . Most of us tend to live in one room most of the time but unless we go into every room every day, even if only to keep it aired, we are not a complete person." -- Rumer Godden

item.title: Kelly add a quote by William Nicholson
item.description: "We read to know we're not alone." -- William Nicholson

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Maurice Sendak
item.description: "And [he] sailed back over a year and in and out of weeks and through a day and into the night of his very own room where he found his supper waiting for him and it was still hot" -- Maurice Sendak

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Maurice Sendak
item.description: "And Max, the king of all wild things, was lonely and wanted to be where someone loved him best of all." -- Maurice Sendak

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Maurice Sendak
item.description: "Oh, please don't go—we'll eat you up—we love you so!" -- Maurice Sendak

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Maurice Sendak
item.description: "Then from far away across the world he smelled good things to eat, so he gave up being king of the wild things." -- Maurice Sendak

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Maurice Sendak
item.description: "But the wild things cried, “Oh please don't go- We'll eat you up- we love you so!" -- Maurice Sendak

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Maurice Sendak
item.description: "And the walls became the world all around." -- Maurice Sendak
